p: The hind limb and brain samples from IEE and IEQ-244E +-infected mice were then processed for histopathological analysis, and results supported earlier findings. Immunohistochemical (IHC) examination revealed massive localization of viral antigens in both IEE and IEQ-244E +-infected muscles, indicating that skeletal muscle is an important replication site ( Fig 3C). Inflammation and extensive muscle damage were also observed in the haematoxylin and eosin (H&E)-stained sections of muscle. Mild inflammation was detected in the cortex. Viral antigens were detected in neuron bodies and their axon dendrites mainly distributed in the pons and dentate nucleus ( Fig 3D). Mononuclear cell infiltrates were also evident in the cortices. In contrast, no distinctive histopathological change was observed in the mock-infected organ samples.
